description.narrative: The objective of the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Emergency Response Project is to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Ethiopia. There are five components to the project, the first component being medical supplies and equipment. This component will finance the procurement of medical supplies and equipment needed for activities outlined in the EPRP such as (i) case management; (ii) infection prevention and control; and (iii) other pillars of the strategic plan. The second component is the preparedness, capacity building and training. This component will finance activities related to preparedness, capacity building and training, guided by the different pillars and activities of the EPRP. The third component is the community discussions and information outreach. Activities supported by this component include: risk communication and community engagement; behavioral and sociocultural risk factors assessments; production of RCCE strategy and training documents; production of communication materials; establish a production center for information and communication tools production center (media and community engagement); and monitoring and evidence generation; and human resources for risk communication. The fourth component is the quarantine, isolation and treatment centers establishment. Activities supported by this component include: establishing isolation and treatment centers, including provision of nutrition and dignity kits to quarantined patients, and equipping them with medical supplies and furniture and network installation. Finally, the fifth component is the project implementation and monitoring.

title.narrative: Achieving the required timeliness of reporting for COVID-19 and other immediately reportable diseases under IDSR
Responding within 24 hours to confirmed outbreaks of COVID-19 and other immediately reportable diseases
For the first 10 suspect cases in the country, percentage of lab results available within 72 hours
Percentage of district health centers/district hospitals with pandemic preparedness and response plans MoH guidelines
Percentage of health facilities with trained staff in infection prevention control per MoH approved protocols
Percentage of district health centers/district hospitals with personal protective equipment and infection control products and supplies, without stock-outs in preceding two weeks
Number of isolation centers, screening sites and quarantine centers established and equipped with medical supplies, protective equipment's and laundry machines.
Number of PoEs, isolation and quarantine centers received weekly supportive supervision and monthly review meetings
Percentage of program-supported regions with pandemic preparedness and response plans per MoH/agriculture guidelines
Number of community conversations conducted at PoEs on their social structure.
Number of designated laboratories with COVID-19 diagnostic equipment, test kits, and reagents per MoH guidelines
Number of established additional screening posts/room
Number of PoEs, isolation centers and quarantine centers that have prepared daily reports
Number of “One Health”-based simulation exercises conducted and certified by MoH/ agriculture at national and sub-national levels
Number of stakeholders at PoEs (Idir ekup, Dagu, and Abageda meetings, Women Development Army, and community leaders) trained.
Number of national contact center (call center) established and equipped with medical supplies and equipment.
Number of monthly assessed (using checklist) PoEs, isolation and quarantine centers
Number of health workers, health facility facilities Surveillance focal persons, PoE screeners, and Woreda, Zonal and regional PHEMofficers trained on COVID-19.
Assessment conducted to identify behavioral and socio-cultural risk factors for COVID-19 covering all the regions.

Number of national and regional influenza laboratories equipped with diagnostic laboratory sample transport materials and Reverse Transcription Rolymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) and negative pressure
Percentage of complaints to the Grievance Redress Mechanism (GRM) satisfactorily addressed within 15 weeks of initial complaint being recorded
Number of health extension workers received orientation to strength COVID-19 community-based surveillance
Number of airports and PoEs received PPE supplies for airport communities and land crossing PoEs.
Number of health workers deployed for COVID-19 preparedness and response.
